intro: Mimosa cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas mimosa, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its bipinnate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It is known for its sensitive leaves that fold shut when touched, a trait shared with other mimosa species. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and valuable plant in botanical studies.
